extendedIngredients.name: baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 pounds baby bok choy, leaves separated from the stems
extendedIngredients.originalName: baby bok choy, leaves separated from the stems

extendedIngredients.name: shiitake mushrooms
extendedIngredients.original: 6 ounces shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded, caps cut into 1-inch pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: shiitake mushrooms, stems discarded, caps cut into 1-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: wine
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons Chinese cooking wine

title: Stir-fried Baby Bok Choy with Shiitake Mushrooms
summary: Stir-fried Baby Bok Choy with Shiitake Mushrooms might be just the side dish you are searching for. This gluten free and vegan recipe serves 6 and costs $2.49 per serving. One serving contains 178 calories, 2g of protein, and 10g of fat. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of baby bok choy, vietnamese stir-fry sauce, garlic cloves, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 15 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 40%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Stir-Fried Baby Bok Choy with Shiitake Mushrooms, Stir-Fried Shiitake Mushrooms with Tofu and Bok Choy, and Bok Choy, Shiitake, and Garlic Noodles.
instructions: In a large skillet or a wok, heat the oil until small puffs of smoke begin to appear. Add the garlic and stir-fry over high heat for 10 seconds. Add the shiitake and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the bok choy and stir-fry until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add the wine and cook until slightly reduced, about 1 minute. Add the Vietnamese Stir-fry Sauce and cook until the bok choy is tender but still bright green and the sauce is slightly reduced, about 4 minutes longer. Serve hot.

steps.step: In a large skillet or a wok, heat the oil until small puffs of smoke begin to appear.
Add the garlic and stir-fry over high heat for 10 seconds.
Add the shiitake and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add the bok choy and stir-fry until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes.
Add the wine and cook until slightly reduced, about 1 minute.
Add the Vietnamese Stir-fry Sauce and cook until the bok choy is tender but still bright green and the sauce is slightly reduced, about 4 minutes longer.
